name: High-density extracellular recordings (Neuropixels/SiNAPS) of Hippocampal-Cortical dynamics during spatial behavior.
citation: Gonzalez, Joaquin (2026) High-density extracellular recordings (Neuropixels/SiNAPS) of Hippocampal-Cortical dynamics during spatial behavior (Version draft) [Data set]. DANDI Archive. https://dandiarchive.org/dandiset/001695/draft
description:
Overview This dataset provides high-density, simultaneous extracellular recordings from the mouse hippocampal formation (DG, CA1, CA2, CA3) and the retrosplenial cortex (RSC). The data captures large-scale neural dynamics across homecage rest, spatial navigation, and sensory stimulation.

Methodology:
Probes: Recordings were performed using Neuropixels 2.0 (CA3, CA1, RSC) and 1024-channel SiNAPS probes (DG, CA3, CA2, CA1).
Behavioral Paradigms: Neuropixels sessions include PRE-rest, Maze navigation (Novel or 2-maze configurations), and POST-rest homecage recordings. A subset of animals includes head-fixed odor stimulation.
SiNAPS sessions include High-density head-fixed recordings.

Data Included:
Sorted isolated units (Spikes).
Local Field Potentials (LFP), specifically including single-channel traces from ripple-detection sites.
Behavioral tracking variables (position, velocity, sleep periods, sharp-wave ripple times).
